intro: Tragacantha seidlitzii, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Iran and Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody, branching structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, inflated pods that contain seeds. Tragacantha seidlitzii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments and is often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and sustainable land management.
